definition: counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

pinyin: dui4 fang1 fu4 kuan3 dian4 hua4
dui4 fang1 fu4 fei4 dian4 hua4

sentences.english: Both labour and management were putting out feelers.
sentences.chinese: 勞資雙方相互試探對方。

sentences.english: The judge placed his hands on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 法官把兩手放在地上，看着對方。

sentences.english: The inside left is passing the opposing side's fullback line.
sentences.chinese: 這左輔正越過對方的後衛線。

sentences.english: We can choose to have a relationship or not.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以選擇建立聯繫或者做對方的陌生人。

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我們在教室相互凝視着，各自嘲笑對方所講的笑話。

sentences.english: Is my partner affectionate to the degree that I expect?
sentences.chinese: 對方愛我的程度是否達到了我的期望？

sentences.english: LYNETTE: You and I have had crushes before. We always tell each other.
sentences.chinese: 你和我都喜歡過別人，我們告訴對方。

sentences.english: Roxanne And that was against some tough defenders .
sentences.chinese: 蘿珊那可是面對對方強悍防守球員的成績。

sentences.english: Mason demands that Jack be turned over as well.
sentences.chinese: 梅森要求對方把傑克交出來。

sentences.english: Seventhly, the two sides reiterated respecting the road of development each other has chosen according to its own national conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雙方重申，尊重對方根據本國國情選擇的發展道路。

sentences.english: We both looked with our mouths open for about five minutes before we said a word.
sentences.chinese: 我們張着嘴巴互相看着對方將近五分鐘，無言而語。

sentences.english: Avoid stepping on adversary's ball and altering competitor's line of putt.
sentences.chinese: 在果嶺是應避免踏越對方球員的球，及進球路線。

sentences.english: These are all to result in of because the indetermination of the other party body.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是因爲對方身份的不確定性而造成的。

sentences.english: Look for non-verbal signals when trying to determine whether someone is interested in you.
sentences.chinese: 當你決定對方否對你有意時，留意非語言性的訊號。

sentences.english: We oohed and aahed over our handiwork as the presents were exchanged.
sentences.chinese: 在交換禮物時爲對方親手做的小禮品不停地歡呼叫好。

sentences.english: We'll understand each other better by exchanging emails.
sentences.chinese: 我們通過互發電子郵件能夠更好地瞭解對方。

definition: to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
